item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Monday, April 14, 2025 at 8:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Gleam v1.10.0 released (44 points | 2 comments)
2. Zig's new LinkedList API (it's time to learn @fieldParentPtr) (20 points | 19 comments)
3. We don’t need no virtualization (11 points | 14 comments)
4. Ship Software That Does Nothing (62 points | 22 comments)
5. Ditch the DIY Drama: Why Use Fedify Instead of Building ActivityPub from Scratch? (15 points | 6 comments)
6. C++20 idioms for parameter packs (9 points | 2 comments)
7. What are you doing this week? (12 points | 17 comments)
8. The Post-Developer Era (6 points | 2 comments)
9. Flat origami is Turing complete (6 points | 1 comment)
10. I bought a Mac (29 points | 6 comments)
11. Algebraic Semantics for Machine Knitting (6 points | 1 comment)
12. git-remote-http is linked against incompatibly licensed OpenSSL (6 points | 1 comment)
13. Mandatory short duration TLS certificates are probably coming soon (27 points | 43 comments)
14. Pretty State Machine Patterns in Rust (5 points | 1 comment)
15. An ssh adventure; or, why l10n support is important (3 points | 1 comment)
16. I've been writing software for the last 25 years. Here are a few more things I've learned so far (part 2) (5 points | no comments)
17. Fun with -fsanitize=undefined and Picolibc (4 points | 1 comment)
18. Python is an interpreted language with a compiler (2 points | 7 comments)
19. SSD1306 display drivers and font rendering (3 points | no comments)
20. MacPad: How I Created the Hybrid Mac-iPad Laptop and Tablet That Apple Won’t Make (2024) (2 points | no comments)
21. htmx Documentation - Caching (4 points | no comments)
22. Anubis works (129 points | 56 comments)
23. An E-Ink PDA device using the ESP32 S3 (33 points | 2 comments)
24. An Ars Technica history of the Internet, part 1 (4 points | no comments)
25. Stasm: GCC/Clang inline assembly wrapper, C macro pre-processor based. ASM for human beings (2 points | no comments)
